fields.description:
If you're trying to enable Pipelines in the Bitbucket UI but you have branch permission configured that no one is allowed to push to the "master" branch. The UI will just send the error message "*Something went wrong*".

*Enhancement Request*:

It would be best to have a descriptive error message about this scenario telling customers that they have had configured branch permission (that no one is allowed to push) and that is why they can't commit a file or enable Pipelines on the UI.

Another option is to auto-create a PR with the YML file so it can be merged into master.
fields.summary: Improve UX when Pipelines can't be enabled because branch permissions are configured

fields.description:
Please provide an option in Pull Requests to delete a branch when it is merged and/or provide a utility within Bitbucket to delete closed branches en masse.

I found many people on the Internet, asking what is the purpose of ‘closing’ a branch, rather than deleting it, and I have not seen any response from Bitbucket.  It seems like the users don’t have a use for this functionality, and it causes problems.  I have scads of branches showing up in the Remotes section in Sourcetree; most of them are closed.  We have no further use for these branches; why should we have to manually delete them?
fields.summary: Provide ability to automatically delete closed branches

fields.description:
Automatic branch selection when making a pull request should be able to be disabled.

I’m currently working on a major feature with PRs going into the feature branch. The automatic branch selection chooses the default develop branch which is hundreds of commits behind the major feature branch. Every PR I have to wait for the automatically chosen branch to finish fetching those hundreds of commits and generate a diff, it takes almost a minute. Only then can I choose the feature branch that I actually want to pr into.

It’s really annoying.
fields.summary: disable automatic branch selection in pull request

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Search string in Pull request-target branch is using substring search instead of string search. For example, the user has production and preproduction branch, user use target branch to search PR that is being created to production, but the list will also show preproduction branch as Bitbucket is using substring search instead of a string.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 branch name Production and Preproduction
# Create a Pull request Branch a > production and Branch b > Preproduction
# Search Production target branch
# It will show both PR created with the different target branch

h3. Expected Results
Search should target string instead of substring

h3. Actual Results
Search is using a substring
fields.summary: Pull request target branch is using substring search to search for target branch

fields.description:
Error code: {{623ff35464ce40f9b02be377545b0aab}}

Trying to access [https://bitbucket.org/account/settings/addon/admin/pipelines/account-variables|https://bitbucket.org/account/settings/addon/admin/pipelines/account-variables] results in the following screen:

!4021393225-image.png|thumbnail!\\
Refreshing the page does not help.

In source code view, I clicked on Annotate from the top right button then got a broken page.

{{2521e22e224447b8bbb6f7f3c4158c9c}}
fields.summary: Error importing a repository

fields.description:
When viewing a PR, on the Activity tab,  the code for some files that are commented on isn’t displayed.  This becomes a problem after a new commit modifies the given file, because after the new commit the older comments aren’t shown together with the code on the Overview tab either, so there is no way left to see which comment belonged to which line.

In my case the given file that isn’t displayed on the Activity tab was a .cshtml with 1470 lines in it.
fields.summary: Comments on PR can't be viewed together with code

fields.description: When I login & create an account via Google I don’t know a password for the account on Bitbucket (email’s password is not accepted), hence I’m unable to e.g. clone repo-s etc. And there is no working method to explicitly setup a password for Bitbucket. E.g. if I go to Atlassian profile settings and try to change password it asks for the *old one* which is unknown yet!
fields.summary: Inconsistent authentication via Google account

fields.description:
Getting the following error:

rpc error: code = Unknown desc = failed to resolve image "[docker.fingerprintsoft.co:8083/fingerprintsoft/digifreight:backup|http://docker.fingerprintsoft.co:8083/fingerprintsoft/digifreight:backup]": no available registry endpoint: [docker.fingerprintsoft.co:8083/fingerprintsoft/digifreight:backup|http://docker.fingerprintsoft.co:8083/fingerprintsoft/digifreight:backup] not found

when using custom docker registries in pipelines as below

{code}
definitions:
  services:
    mssql:
      image:
        name: docker.fingerprintsoft.co:8083/fingerprintsoft/digifreight:backup
        username: $NEXUS_USERNAME
        password: $NEXUS_PASSWORD
        email: fuzail@fingerprintsoft.org
      memory: 3072
{code}
fields.summary: Issue with pipelines

fields.description: If there is a change in master that could be fixed by either a – no-ff merge of master into the topic, or by a rebase of the topic onto master and then push -f into the remote PR branch. In case dev prefers linear history, the rebase approach is preferred. By doing this, comments that have already been made on the PR are now disconnected. It's clear why this happens; there's presumably a lookup between comments and commit sha1s and that get's broken by the rebase/push -f (the same thing happens on github). Though because of the orientation of the approach those comments, which may well be important to the review are relegated to the "activity" tab where is gets buried in all the other screeds that get put there.
fields.summary: Rebasing in a PR appears to detach comments from the conversation

fields.description:
Dear Team,

Kindly note that I have encountered an issue related to Bitbucket repository size, it is increasing in rapid way every time I upload it.  As an example, the apliTV android application - Nexttel Operation repository which is mentioning a 1.1 GB but when I download it, it is mentioning a “This repository's size is over 1 GB. If it reaches 2 GB, we'll restrict the repository to read-only access” note.

Your quick reply is appreciated.

Email: t.hatoum@apli.tv

Best Regards.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Repository Size Issue

Our security officer needs to ensure that all people committing to a pull request could no approve this pull request.\\
Or vice versa: if a developer is assigned as a reviewer within a pull request, he can't commit any change.
fields.summary: Pull request limitations

fields.description: Currently, the pull request will show Author as the one who merges the pull request in the commit tab which sometimes confusing for the customer. It would be great if we can have an option to show who the user who merge the PR instead of the Author.
fields.summary: Option to show the user who merges the Pull request instead of showing the PR author as the merger.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce

# Have with a repository with locked down access (in my case - [https://bitbucket.org/renpillay/functional-programming-in-scala/pull-requests/|https://bitbucket.org/renpillay/functional-programming-in-scala/pull-requests])
# Login with an account that does NOT have access to the above repo, but DOES have 2FA enabled
# Enter that that URL

Result: A loading spinner shows that never resolves

Expected: User is told they don’t have access

Note: If you visit the base repository url (eg [https://bitbucket.org/renpillay/functional-programming-in-scala|https://bitbucket.org/renpillay/functional-programming-in-scala] ) - you are prompted to 2FA and then are told you don’t have access, as expected.
fields.summary: User without access plus 2FA results in an infinite spinner on /pull-requests

fields.description:
I am seeing a 404 in the console when adding a new user.\\
Any new user is getting the email, so no one can work.
fields.summary: Can add new member to my organization bitbucket.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Sometimes users receive an invitation at an email address that is a confirmed Email alias in their Bitbucket account.\\
Since for authentication in Bitbucket only the primary email is used (linked Atlassian account email), if the user tries to accept this invitation, then:

* If an Atlassian account exists for this alias, they are prompted to log in to that Atlassian account and create a new Bitbucket account
* If no Atlassian account exists, they are prompted to create an Atlassian account and Bitbucket account with this email

This experience is sometimes confusing for users, especially if they are not aware that only the primary email can be used for authentication.\\
Users sometimes end up making duplicate accounts they may not need/want.

h3. Suggested Solution
When a user accepts an invitation sent to an Email alias of their account, show a message  when they accept this invitation:

# informing them that the invitation should be sent to the primary email of their account instead
# also add in the message that alternatively, they can create a new Bitbucket account with the email alias
fields.summary: Improve user experience when accepting an Invitation from an Email alias

fields.description: In Go, code formatting is automated, but some devs don't apply the formatting because they have not installed the formatting tools in their dev environment or don't run them. Misformatting is something that needs to be checked in code reviews. Bitbucket misrenders tab length in some situation, making well formatted code look incorrectly formatted.
fields.summary: Bitbucket misrenders tab lengths

It could be nice if the font size for viewing a text file could be adjusted, it could be helpful sometimes.

‌

Also, it should be very nice if colored font can be supported for Python, C, and many other text files.

‌

Thanks so much!
fields.summary: Text File Font Size and Colored Font

fields.description:
h3. Problem
We can’t configure custom steps that allow us to create/update encrypted variables when running a manual build.\\
It blocks use to update credentials in some testing scenarios.
fields.summary: Support secured variables for custom pipeline variables

fields.description:
Customer has complained about the Downloads button missing when his repository is empty, which caused few problems on his deployment, since they had only one repository on their account, they weren’t able to find the Downloads session.

This Request is to include the button even if the repository is empty (as it was in the past).
fields.summary: Downloads button missing when repository is empty.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a Bitbucket Cloud account/team is linked with a JIRA Cloud instance, JIRA issues related to a deployment will show up in the 'Deployment Summary' > tab 'Issues', as per this documentation:\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/see-jira-issues-in-your-deployments-968683936.html

Customers that use JIRA Server instead, are not able to view related issues from their JIRA Server instance in the 'Deployment summary' screen.

h3. Suggested Solution
Show issues related to a deployment in the 'Deployment summary' screen > tab 'Issues' when a JIRA Server instance is integrated with Bitbucket Cloud.
fields.summary: Integration for Bitbucket Pipelines and Deployments with Jira Server

fields.description:
Bitbucket Pipelines does not support IPv6 addresses at the moment, the docker daemon's default configuration which Pipelines is using currently only supports IPv4.

For a docker container to get an IPv6 address it needs to be enabled explicitly in the docker configuration but for Pipelines no such feature is available.

For some users, there might be situations where they are unable to use IPv4 for their builds.
fields.summary: Please support IPv6 in Pipelines

fields.description: In case a user is added to a group, within a team, which has no repository or team permissions, the user is still able to list all the projects. It would be a useful feature to restrict the project listing for those users, who has no repository and team permission.
fields.summary: Restrict project listing

fields.description:
A customer is using basic authentication to authenticate when running MVN with getting repositories from Bitbucket Cloud locally or in Pipelines.

However, intermittently, the customer is getting an "Unauthorized" error.

*Steps were taken by the customer*:

# Create an account
# Change email (without change password)
# Issue starts (no issue on git clone or something else, only on Basic Auth)

*Workaround*:\\
Change password (reset the same password)
fields.summary: MVN Basic Authentication cache issue

fields.description:
I have following configuration:

{code}
image: python:3.6.4-alpine

options:
  docker: true


definitions:
  services:
    postgres:
      image: postgres:10.4-alpine
      memory: 512
    docker:
      memory: 2516
    redis:
      image: redis
      memory: 256

pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        name: "Test Backend"
        image: python:3.6.4-alpine
        services:
          - postgres
          - redis
        caches:
          - pip
        script:
          - apk add --update gcc g++ make bash curl

  branches:
    master:
      - step:
          name: "Build Docker & Deploy - Dev"
          deployment: test
          services:
            - docker
            - postgres
          script:
            - exit 0
{code}

This configuration is passing in validator - [https://bitbucket-pipelines.prod.public.atl-paas.net/validator|https://bitbucket-pipelines.prod.public.atl-paas.net/validator]

Memory allocation for:

* Default: 1024 (default) + 512 + 256 = 1792
* Master: 1024 (default) + 2516 + 512 = 4052

Therefore validator is correct and it can be run.

However pipelines are summing all memories for all services even when they are not specified - so it counts as 1024 (default) + 512 + 2516 + 256 = 4308 - and therefore it fails with error message:

{code}
A step does not have the minimum resources needed to run (1024 MB). Services on the current step are consuming 3284 MB
{code}

‌

Pipelines should count in the limit only services that are using in particular step and not all of them.
fields.summary: Pipelines are computing memory usage incorrectly - they count all services

fields.description:
May be a simple issue or not an issue for most of the community.  But for me it’s pain due to the nature of our SQL script files.

While we are reviewing the code difference in the Pull request, the scroll bar doesn’t hide after swipe.  Sometimes it would hide and makes the code visible, but most of the time it doesn’t and i could not see the code underlying.  I have attached a pic for reference.

It would be nice if we could hide the scrollbar without issues or atleast move the scrollbar after the end of the line.
fields.summary: Scroll Bar Stuck and overlaps on the last line of code in code diff.

fields.description:
This feature request is to add the ability to fetch subfolders within a repository using the Bitbucket API 2.0.\\
Currently, this is possible for files using the endpoint below, however, it is not possible to do this with subdirectories:

https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/src/%7Bnode%7D/%7Bpath%7D
fields.summary: Subfolders via API

fields.description:
The "Message" column only shows the commit title. The lighter text which showed rest of the body of the commit message is not being displayed.

As almost every commit in our repo is a squash commit from the Pull Request GUI, and the default commit message for a squash commit only shows the JIRA ticket and Pull Request number's, we've lost the ability to quickly see the first line of the message body which summarized the actual change.

I had turned off the "Commit list as a single page app" Beta in BitBucket Labs, which solved the problem. Apparently it escaped from Beta?
fields.summary: Commit view is cutting off commit message after first line

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a repository is accessed (cloned, pushed etc.) using access key then "Last used" column is not updated for that access key in repository settings page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access (clone, push) repository on local machine using repository access key
 # Go to repository Settings->Access key and observe that *Last used* column is not updated for the access key used to access the repository

h3. Expected Results

Last used column should be updated for the access with the last time repository was accessed using that access key
h3. Actual Results

Last used column is not be updated for the access key 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cloning a repository using deploy key doesn't update "Last used" column

fields.description:
When trying to connect my repo to my Trello board, I get the message above.

Any feedback?
fields.summary: Cannot read property '0' of undefined

fields.description:
Today I deleted an old ssh key both from my Bitbucket account and my local workstation.

Every ssh interaction is still looking for the deleted key and fails.
fields.summary: ssh keeps asking for old key

fields.description:
Today i deleted an old ssh key both from my Bitbucket account and from my local workstation.

every git operation keeps looking for the old key even if a new one is available and configured.
fields.summary: ssh keeps using old key

fields.description: As for today, Bitbucket allows you to watch and notify actions performed on the repository. That said, we have customers who would want notification for repository creation. But, this currently is not available for slack or E-mail based notification.
fields.summary: Provide options for notifications upon repository creation

fields.description:
I have configured a SSH key in my user profile and my user is assigned to a team as admin and developer. I even tried to add my user as an Admin and Developer on a specific team repository but this doesn’t work either. The clone over HTTPS is still working and even the access over SSH is working if I access my private user repositories.

Locally I have an entry in the ssh config to use a specific SSH key to access. This configuration worked fine in the past but today it suddenly stopped working.

‌

The Bitbucket part of my SSH config

{code}
Host custom.bitbucket
   User git
   Hostname bitbucket.org
   IdentityFile ~/.ssh/custom
{code}

‌

The error when trying to clone:

{code}
$ git clone custom.bitbucket:my-team/my-team-repo.git
Cloning into 'my-team-repo'...
Forbidden
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
{code}
fields.summary: Cannot access team repositories over SSH

fields.description:
Currently, Bitbucket only display the last Build status Icon in the “Repositories” page if the YALM file in the main branch:

# Has a trigger to the "main branch“ in the branch section
# Has a “default” trigger

Due to this behaviour, it is hard to keep track of builds that were:

# Manually triggered
# Custom triggered
# Triggered by a Pull-Request/Tag

We would like to have an option to select with branch will be displayed in the [https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/repositories|https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/repositories] page and, that it does not depend on the YALM file but the last Build Status.

As a workaround for now, we can do the following:

# Set the branch that we want to be displayed as the main branch of the repository
# Update the YALM file to include either, default or/and main branch trigger.
fields.summary: Last Build status Icon not being displayed in the "Repositories" page (BBS-112341)

fields.description:
It would be great if PureScript syntax highlighting support is added.

If direct PureScript highlighting support is not available, can we use Haskell’s syntax highlighter for PureScript files?
fields.summary: PureScript syntax highlighting

But, after committing the change and checking the same from source. It doesn’t highlight the text.

i am admin for repo

Currently, pipelines only allows you to create a Pipelines yml configuration within the repository level.

This feature request requests the ability to add Pipelines yml configurations on account or project levels.
fields.summary: Account/project-wide Pipelines definitions

fields.summary: Missing button for “New File” in Source page.
Missing all project icons

fields.description: When clicking new schedule, I am met with a circle in the middle of the screen that never stops, no box to schedule is opened.
fields.summary: Clicking new schedule on pipeline - infinite circling

fields.description: Deployments cards currently include the last commit, which is often not enough information to identify the branch attached to the pipeline. It takes 2-3 clicks to get back to the branch. It would be wicked awesome if the card would include not only last commit but also branch name (+ direct link) and pull request status (merged, open, etc).
fields.summary: Include Branch Name + Status in Deployments Board

fields.description:
Example: [https://bitbucket.org/chromiumembedded/cef/src/master/|https://bitbucket.org/chromiumembedded/cef/src/master] keeps looping [https://web.archive.org/web20190730170854/http://bitbucket.org/chromiumembedded/cef/src/master/|https://web.archive.org/web20190730170854/http://bitbucket.org/chromiumembedded/cef/src/master].

There is no need to rewrite, as for instance [https://github.com/cefsharp/CefSharp|https://github.com/cefsharp/CefSharp] shows at [https://web.archive.org/web/20190730170913/https://github.com/cefsharp/CefSharp|https://web.archive.org/web/20190730170913/https://github.com/cefsharp/CefSharp].
fields.summary: Avoid Rewriting URL's for reliable archiving (Wayback Machine)

fields.description:
We have a lot of Bitbucket users constantly using Brave browser over the others. Unfortunately, they have been facing compatibility issues and request to add Brave as a supported browser under the list suggested.

Link: https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/which-browsers-does-bitbucket-support-296092232.html
fields.summary: Support for Brave Browser on Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description:
I am using the pip cache, as configured in the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file:

{code}
caches:
  - pip
{code}

The cache is built properly, but when it is downloaded and unpacked, something goes wrong and the http directory of the cache is empty.

I know for sure that on the previous run the pipeline downloaded packages to the http cache and uploaded the cache successfully:

!3124125098-image.png|thumbnail!\\
‌

When it is downloaded it is the correct size:

!968802167-image.png|thumbnail!\\
‌

But if I look at the pip cache directory, something is missing (the total size is only 5.6M!):

!1899529870-image.png|thumbnail!\\
Where did the http cache go?
fields.summary: pip cache isn't working correctly

fields.description:
Currently Makefiles for automake look broken.

Here’s an example: [https://bitbucket.org/ArneBab/conf/src/default/Makefile.am|https://bitbucket.org/ArneBab/conf/src/default/Makefile.am]

Makefiles are typically named Makefile, [Makefile.in|http://Makefile.in], or [Makefile.am|http://Makefile.am]

They should use code-highlighting like Makefiles.
fields.summary: Makefile.am should have Makefile syntax highlighting

fields.description: There's a bug with a private key that has a new line at the end of the key which caused the ssh key to be invalidated. We should have a way to detect this and invalidate the key when the user tries to save it if there's a new line.
fields.summary: Invalidate ssh key if there's a new line

fields.description:
Hello.

I use {{gitflow}} as my git commit strategy, and use {{semantic-release}} as a tool to control my versioning. Since introducing {{semantic-release}}, my {{release}} branch is named just that, _release_, without any other identifiers, as it comes clean from {{develop}} and gets deployed to staging environment.

As I now usually just create the release branch as {{release}}, I have noticed an weird error. If I delete the branch through the checkbox in a "release to master" PR, if I later create a new {{release}} branch, the comparison and PR tools do not detect that the new {{release}} branch has new code. It seems that it keeps a "cached" version of the old release branch and does not allow me to go on.

To work around the issue, I have to either create release branches with different names just because, or I have to forcefully delete the newly create release branch and re-create it. It then seems to "clean up the cache" and allow me to go on.

I have added screenshots showing the clear difference between {{release}} and {{master}} branches in the commit section, and then failure to show the difference in the PR and compare tools.
fields.summary: Branches with same name are not correctly detected by compare and pull requests
Unable to create branch

fields.description:
Garbage strings are being shown for user names in Commit messages, etc.

Affecting multiple accounts from about half an hour ago.
fields.summary: User login name corrupted and displaying "Unknown User"

fields.description: When trying to create a branch, i’m getting a toast error that says “We couldn’t create a branch. If this keeps happening, contact support”.

fields.description:
receiving 500 errors from the server when we try to merge code after a pull request is complete

* workaround: had to manually drop the branch permissions and do the merge by hand from developer machine

we are also seeing all of our users show up as “Unknown User” or represented by their GUID prefixes site wide
fields.summary: Issue merging code

fields.description: When viewing the source of Dart files there is no syntax highlighting.
fields.summary: Dart syntax hilighting

fields.description:
While accessing a private repository, if you use a direct link for the branches page without being logged in, the #react app doesn't prompt or redirects the user to the login screen, instead the page show a “loader” that keeps rotating.

The problem only happens to a some pages as, if you try the “commits” page it works properly.

Additionally, the "access denied" block doesn't appear on the branches page if the user trying to access the private repo doesn't have access to it.
fields.summary: Loading Spinner and Lack of "Access Denied" when accessing private repo outside of session

fields.description: In Bitbucket Server “rebase, merge” is an available strategy. It could be useful feature if it would be available for Bitbucket Cloud
fields.summary: Add "rebase, merge" as a possible merge strategy

fields.description:
Currently, for Bitbucket cloud subscription the only accepted payment method is Credit Card

I would like to have the possibility to use other payment methods like Paypal or bank transfer/ other wallets.
fields.summary: Ability to make payments with other payment methods like Paypal/bank transfer/wallets

fields.description:
As a user who pays a fee to use Bitbucket Cloud, I expect to be able to see a diff always. When it’s too big for the main view, I should be able to click to view it in a different window where you can use more browser resources to render the diff.

!2072127410-Screen%20Shot%202019-07-29%20at%209.21.55%20AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: It's 2019 and we still have "This diff is too big to render"

fields.description: At the moment Bitbucket cloud doesn't have the provision of running garbage collection for Bitbucket LFS storage. But, we do have customers whose workflows might generate many unreferenced "Git LFS" objects and thus request for a more easier implementation rather than implementing the same manually.
fields.summary: Allow running garbage collection on GIT LFS for Bitbucket Cloud
When creating a new issue, the keyboard focus immediately switches from the title field to the description field.

fields.description:
Hey

We are using with Bitbucket cloud and need to use with “Webhooks  on pre committee” in order to combined the name of the Jira ticket with the developer commit

Can someone can help please with this issue ? i know that we are limited on Bitbucket cloud Webhooks but i’m sure there is any solution

Please advise

Thanks

Yossi
fields.summary: Webhooks issue on pre committee

fields.description:
As a user, who want to choose a branch in the Source section, I try to use the branch selector.\\
I expect a list of branches. But in fact I always see preloader.\\
Response to api request has list of branches. ({{/!api/2.0/repositories/<PROJECT>/<REPOSITORY>/refs/branches}})

!4027086971-empty-branch-list.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Empty branch selector.

fields.description:
I can no longer directly add comments to issues using Safari (12.1.2, on macOS 10.14.6), but have to edit the issue to add a comment.

‌

That is:

* Go to an issue (I noticed this on [https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/pyobjc/issues/269/failed-to-setup-if-commandlinetools-is|https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/pyobjc/issues/269/failed-to-setup-if-commandlinetools-is])
* On the bottom is a text box to add a new comment (“What would you like to say?”)
* Clicking on this replaces the basic text box by a rich text control.  This control does not accept text input on Safari.

Workaround:

* Use the “Edit” button in the upper right part of the screen, then edit the comment text.

‌

P.S. I don’t know when this issue started and if it is related to my update to 10.14.6 or an earlier change on bitbucket.org.
fields.summary: Commenting on issues does not work with Safari on macOS 10.14.6

fields.description:
Our bitbucket team page is hidden ("_Hide Bitbucket profile details_" is checked in settings), and all our repositories are private. When a user that isn't logged in visits our team page ([_*https://bitbucket.org/OUR-TEAM-NAME/*_)|https://bitbucket.org/OUR-TEAM-NAME/]) this just results in the message "_You were never here This user has requested we keep their identity a mystery.Let's never speak of this again._"

I think it would be much more logical to *force/trigger a login* when trying to view that page. Otherwise people who actually have access to this page won't see the repositories until they manually log in.

An automatic login trigger for a hidden profile team page would make it consistent with how it currently works with the page of a private repository.

_[Feel free to modify the metadata of this issue, like “Kind” and “Component”, as I am unsure if I selected the right values]_
fields.summary: Trigger login when visiting team page with hidden profile

fields.description:
Hi,

Just wanted to bring to your attention that issue BCLOUD-16560 has over 150 votes from the community, but did not receive any attention from your team in a long while. Can you please revisit it?

Thanks
fields.summary: Issue #16560 feeling neglected (trigger pipeline on change to specific paths in repository)

fields.description: We have the option to remove whitespace when reviewing a PR, giving an option to Ignore whitespace when creating a PR would actually be a lot more useful for both viewing and development as well as unnecessary file/code line commits will no longer be there in the commit history
fields.summary: Option to ignore whitespace when creating a Pull Request

fields.description: I used to look at [https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pipelines|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%257Busername%257D/%257Brepo_slug%257D/pipelines] for the Pipelines API but it is no longer there now. Why did it disappear?
fields.summary: API reference for Bitbucket Pipelines disappeared

fields.description: Hi, we have a repository (REdata_develop) which I configured today to allow feature branches. As an admin, I have been able to push to the new feature branches without a problem, but the rest of the team remains locked out despite my configuring feature branches to be writeable. Am I missing a checkbox somewhere?
fields.summary: Repository not allowing pushes into feature branches despite configuration.

fields.description:
Say I have two branches: {{main}} and {{dev}}. If I push local commits to remote {{dev}} and I want to merge them into {{main}}, I head over to the repository on Bitbucket.

I used to be able to open the Branches page, and simply click *Create pull request* on {{dev}} to create a PR into {{main}}, like so:

!584416151-image.png|thumbnail!\\
‌

But now, what I’m presented with is the tally of all the PRs:

!1154408617-image.png|thumbnail!\\
‌

I have to head into “Pull requests” and pick my branches from there, instead of having a rather simplified but super-quick experience.

Is there a way to revert to the old “quick-PR” experience? I really liked how convenient that was.

Thanks!
fields.summary: “Create pull request" link no longer present on Branch list in the Pull Request column

fields.description:
To whom it may concern,

‌

Hi, I need to delete the following repository which is unavailable.

[https://bitbucket.org/crediation/cc-company-fs-datasync|https://bitbucket.org/crediation/cc-company-fs-datasync]

‌

Referring to the issue below, I suppose there is no way but raising an issue for the deletion.

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Delete-unavailable-repository/qaq-p/397647|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Delete-unavailable-repository/qaq-p/397647]

Would you please delete the repository?

‌

Thank you in advance.

‌

Best regards,

‌

Naoki
fields.summary: I cannot delete an unavailable repository

fields.description:
When creating a pull request with the 2.0 API, *and not passing a description*, my expectation would be that the description is filled in by the default bullet point list of commits, but this isn't the case.

When using the UI, this _is_ the default.

It would be great to have a flag, such as “use_default_description”, which defaults to false (to maintain BC) when creating a pull request with the v2.0 API. Setting this flag to true would use the default description as if the user were using the UI.

See [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Bitbucket-2-0-Api-Open-Pull-Request-DEFAULT-DESCRIPTION/qaq-p/1137937?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=mentions_answer&utm_content=topic|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Bitbucket-2-0-Api-Open-Pull-Request-DEFAULT-DESCRIPTION/qaq-p/1137937%3Futm_source%3Datlcomm%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_campaign%3Dmentions_answer%26utm_content%3Dtopic].
fields.summary: Option to use default description when creating Pull Requests

fields.description: Trying to push to git, I am getting this error message. You can use git or hg to connect to Bitbucket. Shell access is disabled. I already deleted and re-added my SSH key and still receiving this error.
fields.summary: You can use git or hg to connect to Bitbucket. Shell access is disabled

fields.description:
When reviewing a pull request, click the [+] icon to add a comment to a line from a source file, and start adding text.

If you now click [+] icon to add a comment on another line, Bitbucket closes the first comment _without warning or confirmation_ and opens a new comment form on the second line. BitBucket should confirm you want to discard the first comment. (Ideally, Bitbucket should also allow multiple comments, and perhaps warn users that there are open comments or allow navigation to next/prev comment so that it is harder to forget about other comments)
fields.summary: Starting a new pull request comment causes an unsaved comment to be lost

fields.description:
When entering comments on a pull request review ( {{.../diff#add-comment}} [+] button on line numbers in the PR) , sometimes the page will simply freeze while I’m in the middle of typing the comment or possibly scrolling to view other code before returning to the comment field. I can no longer type in the comment box or save the comment. I also cannot interact with the page in other ways - pressing F12 to open the Chrome Inspector does not work. Eventually Chrome will detect the problem and pop up a dialeg telling me the page is unresponsive and asks if I want to wait or kill the page. Waiting does not work - it never comes back, and thus it loses all the text I've entered in the comment field.

If I try to refresh the page to restart the PR review, Chrome marks the tab as dead and the tab remains blank.

This is intermittent but has happened to me perhaps 5 or 6 times in the last week.

I’m using Chrome 75.0.3770.142 on OS X. I’ve restarted Chrome and rebooted a few times since this has started and cleared my cache as well.
fields.summary: BitBucket cloud freezes (becomes unresponsive) when entering comments

fields.description:
The Username on Bitbucket can be currently found only under:

Either via Bitbucket Settings >> Account Settings or from the URL.\\
Users are requesting for the username to be made available over the views such as "View Profile" and prevent the hassle involved in getting through Bitbucket setting all the time.
fields.summary: Make Bitbucket username visible under "View Profile"

fields.description:
Trying to include code blocks inside numbered lists do not render correctly.

Here is an example md snippet:

{code}
1. Something

    ``` objc
    #import <Foundation/Foundation.h>
    ```
    
2. Something else
{code}

‌

Which renders:

!1668037032-Screenshot%202019-07-24%20at%2014.44.16.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Codeblocks inside lists do not render correctly

fields.description:
If you click the “like” button the call will return a 404 error:

!1750988511-image.png|thumbnail!\\
!3644495983-image.png|thumbnail!\\
Example URL:

[https://bitbucket.org/!api/internal/repositories/goldinteractive/resortragaz/commit/ad408de0f0175cee1b55fc7685ce92ea671f4702/comments/7732029/likes|https://bitbucket.org/%21api/internal/repositories/goldinteractive/resortragaz/commit/ad408de0f0175cee1b55fc7685ce92ea671f4702/comments/7732029/likes]

It’s happening on all the repositories and comments.
fields.summary: Click Like button on commit comments gives 404 (API)

fields.description: How to reduce pack file size ?
fields.summary: Repository Space Limit Exceeded (2 GB)

fields.description: Currently, there are no restriction settings in the organization team account so a user in the organization can create a public repository or new team etc. It would be great if we can have an organization restriction for Bitbucket team account that admin has more control over their user.
fields.summary: User restriction in organisation Team account

fields.description:
At the moment we take a screenshot the list of issues from the deployment dialog and paste it into our slack channel.  Every time we release to staging everyone needs to sanity test their own tickets manually.

I would really like it if I could get Pipelines to do this for us.  A link to the deployment dialog would be a good first step.  Listing the issues (formatted with assignee) would be awesome!

Thanks!
fields.summary: Deployment environment diff available in slack

fields.description:
Currently our deployment is set up in 3 stages - ‘staging’, ‘cloud production', and 'server production'.  Each of these is a manual step.

When we deploy to staging I love the list of tickets included since the last release.  However, after I have release to staging, I then need to verify all these tickets before I hit the next deploy button.

I spent the last 4 weeks assuming that it wasn’t possible to see this view again.  All the team members would take a screenshot of the dialog and paste it into the chat room.  If you forgot - or lost the screenshot there seemed to be no way to get it back.

Someone recently pointed out I can get it via the deployments dashboard (I did look here originally, but the history view looked like a list of commits not a list of deployments).  This helps, however, the information is not where I need it when I need it → before I press the next deployment button.

I will raise another feature request to get this information displayed nicely in slack, so we don’t need to screenshot!
fields.summary: I need access to the list of changes in a deployment from the pipeline.

fields.description: As an user, it would be useful to have an API endpoint to retrieve links for each repository, to easily check if links are enabled and correctly configured in the specific repo.
fields.summary: API to be able to retrieve Jira links from repos

fields.description: I think it would be really nice for pull requests, which have multiple contributors, to have a way to blame the diff and see who did what change. It would also be nice to see what commit message goes along with each line in large PRs, such that you can see the logic behind each change.
fields.summary: Blame on New Pull Request

fields.description:
At the time of push or checkout it is showing the error /info/refs not valid: is this a git repository?

Please do the needful.
fields.summary: Fatal error "not a git repository" Git

fields.description:
Normally, the commits page should show tags for each commit on the right side, but for some reason it rarely does that now. If I refresh the page multiple times (with disabled caching via devtools), about one in a dozen times the tags do show up.

Also sometimes while doing this, I get a version where markdown formatting is applied to commit messages, resulting in commits that start with a hashtag being rendered as giant headings.
fields.summary: Commits page doesn't always show tags

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the number of characters in:

* a PR description
* plus in the commit messages of the commits belonging to this PR

exceed 2000 characters, users get a 500 error when trying to marge this PR

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create a PR with a description of more than 2000 characters

or

Create a PR whose description plus commit messages exceed 2000 characters

Then try to merge this PR

h3. Expected Results
The PR gets merged

h3. Actual Results
User gets a 500 error when merging the PR

h3. Workaround
# Merge the PR via an API call
# Merge locally and push
# Edit the PR's description to be less than 2000 characters (if applicable)

h3. Notes
It would be useful if the user would get an error message indicating the issue and also workarounds, instead of a generic 500 error.
fields.summary: Merging a PR with a description of more than 2000 characters gives a 500 error

fields.description:
Hi,

I discovered that users who were part of a team and were removed after a while can still pull changes for already configured repositories. This is a big security leak….can someone check ?
fields.summary: removed users still have access to repositories

fields.description: !1703276337-image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Love to see a sticky 'changed files' tree on the left as I'm scrolling a Pull Request

fields.description:
This feature request is to add further debug information on builds, either when the build fails or when a specific flag is added to the yml, like "debug" for instance.

Showing the amount of memory in use for each container in real-time during the build (both build and service containers) instead of just showing the amount of allocated memory to each container (which is what Pipelines does today if you hover your mouse over the service's name in Pipelines), as well as the amount of CPU utilized during builds would be very useful for troubleshooting and debugging purposes.\\
It would be fairly useful to also show the processes that are currently running on the container and their memory utilization, with timestamps.
fields.summary: BBS-111264 - Add Pipelines Memory and CPU debug information

fields.description:
Hey guys,

I have a private repository with a {{bitbucket-pipelines.yml}} in the root directory. I am currently migrating all of our CI tooling from Jenkins to Bitbucket pipelines.

This particular repository uses Git LFS. I enabled the clone with Git LFS using the clone section of the pipeline. Here is my valid pipeline:

{code}
image: zhughes3/ubuntu-ruby-node:latest

clone:
  lfs: true

pipelines:
  custom:
    manual:
      - step:
          script:
            - pwd
            - ls -al
  branches: 
    develop:
      - step:
          script:
            - pwd
            - ls -al
    release/*:
      - step:
          script:
            - pwd
            - ls -al
{code}

Here is the output from the Pipeline:

{code}
+ umask 000
+ git clone -n https://x-token-auth:$REPOSITORY_OAUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN@bitbucket.org/$BITBUCKET_REPO_FULL_NAME.git $BUILD_DIR
Cloning into &#39;/opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build&#39;...
+ git checkout 974062f284292a880b1d58c0278ffae1770cbf60
Downloading B2C-Templates/iamtemplates/images/brand.png (8.7 KB)
Error downloading object: B2C-Templates/iamtemplates/images/brand.png (89e49e8): Smudge error: Error downloading B2C-Templates/iamtemplates/images/brand.png (89e49e8324d505aa0edb96593e241378b727c699efa99ffe4a305aef857c9e5f): [89e49e8324d505aa0edb96593e241378b727c699efa99ffe4a305aef857c9e5f] Object does not exist on the server: [404] Object does not exist on the server
Errors logged to /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/.git/lfs/logs/20190722T161835.702758305.log
Use `git lfs logs last` to view the log.
error: external filter &#39;git-lfs filter-process&#39; failed
fatal: B2C-Templates/iamtemplates/images/brand.png: smudge filter lfs failed
{code}

We had seen the same exact issue in Jenkins. To fix this, we had to enable a setting to manually run a {{git lfs pull &lt;GIT_ORIGIN&gt;}} after doing the {{git checkout <TAG>}} . How do I perform a {{git lfs pull}} in the above pipeline?

Also, I initially set the {{clone -> lfs: true}} after finding this [article|https://bitbucket.org/blog/git-lfs-now-available-bitbucket-pipelines]. In it, it talks about manually &-#34~~;include an appropriate Git client in your build image, and pull with SSH authentication to retrieve the files.&~~#34-; How would I do this if the pipeline automatically tries to clone the repository that the {{bitbucket-pipelines.yml}} file lives in?
fields.summary: Cloning a repo with LFS from bitbucket-pipelines.yml is not working as expected

fields.description:
I'm an admin on our corporate Bitbucket account and it’d be very useful to be able to opt-out of email notifications when another admin adds a deploy key to a repo?

I know I can suppress them on a repo-by-repo basis, but it would be very useful to be able to suppress them site-wide.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Feature request: Ability to suppress deploy-key notifications sitewide

fields.description:
Hello Team,

Suddenly I have started getting the below error while pushing to my master branch:

git push origin master\\
Enumerating objects: 13, done.\\
Counting objects: 100% (13/13), done.\\
Delta compression using up to 4 threads\\
Compressing objects: 100% (7/7), done.\\
Writing objects: 100% (7/7), 666 bytes | 666.00 KiB/s, done.\\
Total 7 (delta 4), reused 0 (delta 0)\\
remote: Permission denied to update branch master.\\
To [bitbucket.org|http://bitbucket.org]:netvacation/devops-repo.git\\
! [remote rejected] master -> master (pre-receive hook declined)\\
error: failed to push some refs to 'git@bitbucket.org:netvacation/devops-repo.git'

Is there any problem with Bitbucket currently or any setting got changed with this repository specifically? I am able to push to my other repository. Let me know if by any chance any permission got changed mistakenly.

Regards,

Gaurav
fields.summary: Not able to push to my Master Branch even I am the Admin of the it
Other Member PRs are always show updated

fields.description:
Hi Team,

Since as per the new changes, we are requested to provide access to user with email address only, so, while revoking or changing access of any user, we need their email address to be visible in bit bucket. Please add it as a feature to support.
fields.summary: Ability to view and export email address for team members

fields.description:
Where looking at a file's diff, you can spot changes with the green/red background as well as the {{+}} and {{-}} signs at the start of the line. This is a nice feature, but it becomes a problem when you want to select and copy multiple lines: the indicators get copied as well.

My proposal is to get rid of these “hard-coded” indicators and replace them with a CSS pseudo-element so that they do not appear upon selection.

I have put together a script that you can use as a bookmarklet to test the idea out:\\
[https://codepen.io/chrisknmojo/full/LwPgRG|https://codepen.io/chrisknmojo/full/LwPgRG]

It is a small enhancement that would make it easy to share code with colleagues, for instance, or to copy a few lines from one project to another very easily.

Let me know if this needs further clarification!

Thanks.
fields.summary: Make diff-checker line change indicators (+ and -) into pseudo-elements to render them unselectable
